page.title: 05RELIGION IN NORTH FERRIBY.
page.content: Of the people surveyed many said that they sometimes attended a place of worship.Fewer people said they never attended and even less said they often attended a place of worship.The majority of those who stated their denomination were Anglicans,who at sometime or other attended All Saints' Church.The next in number were Methodists,who also worshipped in the local Methodist Church.There were some members of both denominations who worshipped elsewhere.As there is no local Roman Catholic Church,all members attended a church elsewhere. Other Christian denominations represented in the village are the Salvation Army,Society of Friends, Independent and Interdenominational Christians,no other Christian denomination appeared,nor did evidence of non-Christian religions.
